long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Hash X: Twitter Hashtag & Keyword Blocker

Take control of your Twitter/X feed with Hash X - the ultimate tool for filtering and customizing your browsing experience. Whether you want to avoid spoilers, block unwanted content, or ensure important tweets are always visible, Hash X has got you covered.

Key Features:

• Filter by Hashtags:
Block tweets containing specific hashtags. Simply add the hashtags you want to filter out, and enjoy a cleaner feed. Example: Enter “ElonMusk” to hide tweets containing this hashtag.

• Filter by Text:
Customize your feed by blocking tweets with specific keywords or phrases. Add any text you want to filter out, and improve your browsing experience. Example: Enter “some text” to block tweets containing this phrase.

• Whitelist Users:
Ensure you never miss tweets from important users. Add usernames to your whitelist, and their tweets will always be visible, regardless of the content. Example: Add “username” to whitelist their tweets.

• Blacklist Users:
Block all tweets from specific users. Add usernames to your blacklist, and their tweets will be hidden from your feed. Example: Add “ElonMusk” to blacklist their tweets.

• Enable or Disable Filters:
Easily toggle tweet filtering on or off without losing your settings. Perfect for temporary changes to your feed preferences.

Why Install Hash X?

• Enhanced Browsing Experience:
Take control of your Twitter/X feed by filtering out unwanted content and focusing on what matters to you.

• Easy to Use:
Simple, intuitive interface allows you to add or remove filters with just a few clicks.

• Customizable:
Tailor your feed to your preferences with powerful filtering options, including hashtags, text, and user-specific controls.

• Privacy-Focused:
Your data is stored locally and securely, ensuring your privacy and control over your settings.

How to Use:

1. Install the Extension:
Add Hash X to your browser from the Chrome Web Store.

2. Open the Extension:
Click on the Hash X icon in your browser toolbar to open the popup interface.

3. Add Filters:
Use the intuitive interface to add hashtags, text, or users to your filters.

4. Save Your Settings:
Click “Save” to apply your filters and enjoy a customized Twitter/X feed.
